analyzed: de bzhin zhes pa dbang bskur ba'o //

original: mchog gi dngos grub ces pa bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa rang shes bya dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa 'gog pa las sa bcu gnyis thob pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid de ;
analyzed: mchog gi dngos grub ces pa bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa rang shes bya dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa 'gog pa las sa bcu gnyis thob pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid de ;
translated: The mundane powers are the lordship up to the end of existence in Akaniṣṭha, and the supreme power is the perfect complete Buddhahood, which is the cessation of the afflictions together with their traces, and the cessation of the obstructions to the knowables and to meditative equipoise, by attaining the twelfth stage.

original: de'i ched du'o //
analyzed: de'i ched du'o //
translated: It is for that purpose.

original: mdor bsdus pa yis zhes pa gsol ba 'debs pa po nyon mongs pa dang bskal ba dang sems can dang lta ba dang tshe'i mtshan nyid kyi snyigs ma lngas nye bar bcom pa'i skye bo rjes su 'dzin par mngon par dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa yis zhes pa gsol ba 'debs pa po nyon mongs pa dang bskal ba dang sems can dang lta ba dang tshe'i mtshan nyid kyi snyigs ma lngas nye bar bcom pa'i skye bo rjes su 'dzin par mngon par dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the brief, the petitioner is one who is intent on taking care of people who are overcome by the five degenerations of afflictions, eons, sentient beings, views, and lifespans.

original: dang po'i sangs rgyas ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'i ston pa po'i lan gsungs pa /
analyzed: dang po'i sangs rgyas ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'i ston pa po'i lan gsungs pa /
translated: The answer of the teacher who is absorbed in the samādhi of the primordial Buddha is stated:

original: nyon cig ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon cig ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Listen!

original: dbang bskur don zhes pa dbang bskur dang de'i dgos pa'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur don zhes pa dbang bskur dang de'i dgos pa'o //
translated: The consecration is the consecration and its purpose.

original: mchog ces pa mchog tu mi 'gyur pa ste /
analyzed: mchog ces pa mchog tu mi 'gyur pa ste /
translated: The supreme is the unchanging supreme.

original: mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba'i thabs nyid kyi phyir lhag par 'dod pa ma yin pa yang ngo //
analyzed: mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba'i thabs nyid kyi phyir lhag par 'dod pa ma yin pa yang ngo //
translated: Because it is the means of unchanging bliss, it is also not desired.

original: rtsa'i kun spyod la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rtsa'i kun spyod la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The conduct of the nāḍīs, and so on, is stated.

original: steng dang 'og tu la la n'a la sogs pa rtsa drug po rnams su 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rim pas srog dang thur sel gyi rlung yang dag par rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: steng dang 'og tu la la n'a la sogs pa rtsa drug po rnams su 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rim pas srog dang thur sel gyi rlung yang dag par rgyu ba'o //
translated: The conduct of the nāḍīs is the movement of the prāṇa and āyāma vāyus in the six nāḍīs, such as the lalanā above and below, in the order that will be explained.

original: rtsol pa ni zhes pa /
analyzed: rtsol pa ni zhes pa /
translated: The effort is🔽the cessation of the vāyu.

original: yams nye bar 'gog pa'o zhes pa'i dbyings 'di'i /🔽a'a ste kun nas 'gog pa ni srog rtsol te /
analyzed: yams nye bar 'gog pa'o zhes pa'i dbyings 'di'i / a'a ste kun nas 'gog pa ni srog rtsol te /
translated: The dhātu of this is ā.🔽The cessation of all is prāṇāyāma.

original: srog dang @2b thur sel gyi rlung dag 'gog pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: srog dang @2b thur sel gyi rlung dag 'gog pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is the cessation of the prāṇa and āyāma vāyus.

original: mdor bstan pa yis zhes pa mdor bsdus pas so //
analyzed: mdor bstan pa yis zhes pa mdor bsdus pas so //
translated: By brief indication is meant by brief summary.

original: rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma la sogs pa'i rgyud thams cad du mdor bstan pa rnam pa gsum ste rgyas par bshad pa yang ngo //
analyzed: rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma la sogs pa'i rgyud thams cad du mdor bstan pa rnam pa gsum ste rgyas par bshad pa yang ngo //
translated: In all the Tantras of the Yoginis and Yogis there are three kinds of brief indications and also extensive explanations.

original: de la mdor bstan pa rang ming nyid kyis brjod pa'o ;
analyzed: de la mdor bstan pa rang ming nyid kyis brjod pa'o ;
translated: Therein, the brief indication is expressed by its own name.

original: / rab tu mdor bstan pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: / rab tu mdor bstan pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The very brief indication is the second.

original: mdor bstan che ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: mdor bstan che ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The great brief indication is the third.

original: de bzhin du rgyas par bshad pa yang rang ming nyid kyis brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyas par bshad pa yang rang ming nyid kyis brjod pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the extensive explanation is also expressed by its own name.

original: rab tu rgyas par bshad pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu rgyas par bshad pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The very extensive explanation is the second.

original: gzhan zhes pa rgyas par bshad pa chen po ste gsum pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan zhes pa rgyas par bshad pa chen po ste gsum pa'o //
translated: The other is the great extensive explanation, which is the third.

original: mdor bstan pa dang rgyas par bshad pa dag nyid ni rgyud yang dag par bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: mdor bstan pa dang rgyas par bshad pa dag nyid ni rgyud yang dag par bsdus pa ste /
translated: The brief indication and the extensive explanation themselves are the perfect summary of the Tantra.

original: de la mdor bstan pa yang dag par bsdus pa ni nyung du'i rgyud mtha' dag ste dper na brgya phrag bco brgyad pa'i gzhung dpal 'dus pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la mdor bstan pa yang dag par bsdus pa ni nyung du'i rgyud mtha' dag ste dper na brgya phrag bco brgyad pa'i gzhung dpal 'dus pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Therein, the brief indication is the perfect summary of the entire short Tantra, for example, the text of the Eighteen Thousand, the glorious Guhyasamaja, and so forth.

original: rgyas par bshad pa yang dag par bsdu ba ni rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rgyal po bstan pa mtha' dag ste dper na stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa'i dpal 'dus pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgyas par bshad pa yang dag par bsdu ba ni rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rgyal po bstan pa mtha' dag ste dper na stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa'i dpal 'dus pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The extensive explanation is the complete teaching of the king of the root tantra, for example, the glorious Guhyasamaja in twenty-five thousand lines.

original: de bzhin du rab tu mdor bstan gyi nyung du'i rgyud la dka' 'grel lo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rab tu mdor bstan gyi nyung du'i rgyud la dka' 'grel lo //
translated: Similarly, the commentary on the difficult points is for the brief tantra of the concise explanation.

original: 'dir rgyas par bshad pa ni rab tu rgyas bshad du mngon par 'dod de /
analyzed: 'dir rgyas par bshad pa ni rab tu rgyas bshad du mngon par 'dod de /
translated: Here, the extensive explanation is considered to be the extensive explanation,

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud la dka' 'grel lo //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud la dka' 'grel lo //
translated: and the commentary on the difficult points is for the root tantra.

original: de bzhin du mdor bstan chen pos nyung du'i rgyud la rgya che 'grel lo //
analyzed: de bzhin du mdor bstan chen pos nyung du'i rgyud la rgya che 'grel lo //
translated: Similarly, the extensive commentary is for the brief tantra of the great explanation.

original: 'dir rgyas par bshad pa ni rgyas bshad chen por mngon par 'dod de /
analyzed: 'dir rgyas par bshad pa ni rgyas bshad chen por mngon par 'dod de /
translated: Here, the extensive explanation is considered to be the great extensive explanation,

original: rgyas bshad chen pos rtsa ba'i rgyud la rgya che 'grel lo //
analyzed: rgyas bshad chen pos rtsa ba'i rgyud la rgya che 'grel lo //
translated: and the extensive commentary is for the root tantra of the great extensive explanation.

original: de ni ste yang dag par sdud pa dang dka' 'grel dang rgya che 'grel te gsum ka'ang /
analyzed: de ni ste yang dag par sdud pa dang dka' 'grel dang rgya che 'grel te gsum ka'ang /
translated: That is, the correct compilation, the commentary on the difficult points, and the extensive commentary, all three,

original: mngon shes thob rnams kyis zhes pa lha'i mig dang lha'i rna ba dang pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang rang dang gzhan gyi sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i rdzu 'phrul thob pa rnams kho na nas bya'o //
analyzed: mngon shes thob rnams kyis zhes pa lha'i mig dang lha'i rna ba dang pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang rang dang gzhan gyi sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i rdzu 'phrul thob pa rnams kho na nas bya'o //
translated: Those who have attained superknowledge means only those who have attained the divine eye, divine ear, knowledge of others' minds, recollection of past lives, and the magical power of flying in the sky.

original: mkhas rnams kyis min nyid ces pa rtog ge skam po goms pas sems kyi rgyud nye bar bcom pa /
analyzed: mkhas rnams kyis min nyid ces pa rtog ge skam po goms pas sems kyi rgyud nye bar bcom pa /
translated: Not by the wise means not by those whose mental continuum has been thoroughly subdued by familiarity with dry logic,

original: so so rang gi rig par bya ba nang gi bdag nyid sgom pa la kha phyir phyogs pa rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: so so rang gi rig par bya ba nang gi bdag nyid sgom pa la kha phyir phyogs pa rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: who are turned away from the meditation on the inner nature that is to be known by oneself.🔽Thus, this purity is by the six parameters such as brief indication, and so forth, up to the world realms, and so forth.

original: de ltar mdor bstan pa la sogs pa mtha' drug rnams kyis dang ji srid du 'jig rten khams la sogs pa'i bar rnams kyis dag pa 'di ni dang po'i sangs rgyas kyi @3a * //
analyzed: de ltar mdor bstan pa la sogs pa mtha' drug rnams kyis dang ji srid du 'jig rten khams la sogs pa'i bar rnams kyis dag pa 'di ni dang po'i sangs rgyas kyi @3a * //
translated: This is the tantra of the primordial Buddha,

original: rgyud do // shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / chos dang sngags dang dbyibs kyi rdo rje'i rnal 'byor rnams kyis te /
analyzed: rgyud do // shin tu rnam par dag pa dang / chos dang sngags dang dbyibs kyi rdo rje'i rnal 'byor rnams kyis te /
translated: by the extremely pure, and by the yogas of the vajra of phenomena, mantra, and shape.

original: stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa dang mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i rnam par thar pa rnams snying rje dang byams pa dang dga' ba dang / btang snyoms kyi tshangs pa'i gnas rnams la lhan cig rim pa ltar ro mnyam pa'i ngo bo can /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa dang mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i rnam par thar pa rnams snying rje dang byams pa dang dga' ba dang / btang snyoms kyi tshangs pa'i gnas rnams la lhan cig rim pa ltar ro mnyam pa'i ngo bo can /
translated: The four doors of liberation—emptiness, absence of attributes, absence of aspiration, and absence of formation—are the essence of the four brahma abodes of compassion, love, joy, and impartiality.

original: bzhi pa dang shin tu gnyid log pa dang rmi lam dang sad pa'i gnas skabs 'jig par byed pa /
analyzed: bzhi pa dang shin tu gnyid log pa dang rmi lam dang sad pa'i gnas skabs 'jig par byed pa /
translated: The fourth is the essence of the dissolution of the states of deep sleep, dreams, and waking.

original: lhan cig skyes pa dang chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku'i ngo bo rnams kyis so //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa dang chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku'i ngo bo rnams kyis so //
translated: The fifth is the essence of the coemergent, dharma, enjoyment, and emanation bodies.

original: skad cig gcig dang rnam pa lnga dang rnam pa nyi shu dang sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rnams kyis zhes pa la /
analyzed: skad cig gcig dang rnam pa lnga dang rnam pa nyi shu dang sgyu 'phrul dra ba'i mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rnams kyis zhes pa la /
translated: The sixth is the essence of the five moments of manifest enlightenment, the twenty aspects of manifest enlightenment, and the manifest enlightenment of the magical net.

original: skye ba'i rim pas pha dang ma dag gi gnyis ka'i thig le ro mnyam par gyur pa'i ma'i gsang ba'i 'khor lor skye bar 'dod pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gang skad cig gcig po bde ba yang dag par rig pa 'ba' zhig pa //
analyzed: skye ba'i rim pas pha dang ma dag gi gnyis ka'i thig le ro mnyam par gyur pa'i ma'i gsang ba'i 'khor lor skye bar 'dod pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gang skad cig gcig po bde ba yang dag par rig pa 'ba' zhig pa //
translated: The consciousness of the ground of all, which is the desire to be born, is the single moment of consciousness that is the sole awareness of bliss.

original: lus kyang nya ro hi ta ltar rnam pa gcig pa de ni skad cig gcig gis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyang nya ro hi ta ltar rnam pa gcig pa de ni skad cig gcig gis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'o //
translated: The body, which is of one type like a rohita fish, is the single moment of manifest complete enlightenment.

original: gang gi tshe mngal na gnas pa de nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa'i bag chags kyi bdag nyid can shes pa lnga yang dag par rig cing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mngal na gnas pa de nyid kyi gzugs la sogs pa'i bag chags kyi bdag nyid can shes pa lnga yang dag par rig cing /
translated: When the five consciousnesses, which are of the nature of the latent tendencies of form and so on, are aware of them,

original: rus sbal ltar 'bur po'i rnam pa lnga 'thon pa de'i tshe rnam pa lnga mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: rus sbal ltar 'bur po'i rnam pa lnga 'thon pa de'i tshe rnam pa lnga mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'o //
translated: and five protuberances like turtle backs appear, that is the fivefold manifest complete enlightenment.

original: de nas gang gi tshe shes pa lnga po rnams kyi so so rang gi sa la sogs pa'i bag chags kyi dbye ba dang / lus sor mo nyi shu rdzogs pa de'i tshe rnam pa nyi shus mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: de nas gang gi tshe shes pa lnga po rnams kyi so so rang gi sa la sogs pa'i bag chags kyi dbye ba dang / lus sor mo nyi shu rdzogs pa de'i tshe rnam pa nyi shus mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'o //
translated: Then, when the five cognitions are differentiated by the propensities of their individual spheres, and the body is complete with twenty fingers and toes, then there is manifest perfect enlightenment with twenty aspects.

original: de nas mngal nas 'thon te sgyu ma'i dra ba ltar mtha' yas pa'i dngos po yang dag par rig pa ni sgyu 'phrul dra bas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: de nas mngal nas 'thon te sgyu ma'i dra ba ltar mtha' yas pa'i dngos po yang dag par rig pa ni sgyu 'phrul dra bas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'o //
translated: Then, when one emerges from the womb, and one is aware of infinite things as a magical net, then there is manifest perfect enlightenment by the magical net.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pas ni du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma bcu po rnams kyi chung du dang 'bring dang chen po dang shin tu chen po'i dbye bas sgrub pa bzhi po rnams rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa rnams so //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pas ni du ba la sogs pa'i mtshan ma bcu po rnams kyi chung du dang 'bring dang chen po dang shin tu chen po'i dbye bas sgrub pa bzhi po rnams rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa rnams so //
translated: By the completion stage, the four perfections are the perfect enlightenments, by the divisions of small, medium, great, and very great of the ten signs such as smoke, etc.

original: phung po rnams kyis ni gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa dang ye shes rnams kyis so //
analyzed: phung po rnams kyis ni gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa dang ye shes rnams kyis so //
translated: By the aggregates, the perfect enlightenments are by the forms, feelings, discriminations, composites, and consciousnesses, and by the pristine awarenesses.

original: khams rnams kyis ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' dang ye shes rnams kyis @3b so ;
analyzed: khams rnams kyis ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha' dang ye shes rnams kyis @3b so ;
translated: The elements are earth, water, fire, wind, space, and wisdom.

original: / skye mched rnams kyis ni lus dang lce dang mig dang sna dang rna ba dang yid dang / dri dang gzugs dang ro dang reg bya dang chos kyi dbyings rnams kyis so //
analyzed: / skye mched rnams kyis ni lus dang lce dang mig dang sna dang rna ba dang yid dang / dri dang gzugs dang ro dang reg bya dang chos kyi dbyings rnams kyis so //
translated: The sense bases are body, tongue, eyes, nose, ears, and mind, and smell, form, taste, touch, and the realm of phenomena.

original: mang po'i tshig las bshad lam dang rkang pa dang lag pa dang ngag dang mdoms dang dung can ma dang / bshad ba gtong ba dang 'gro ba dang len pa dang smra brjod dang gci ba 'dzag pa dang khu ba 'pho ba rnams kyis te /
analyzed: mang po'i tshig las bshad lam dang rkang pa dang lag pa dang ngag dang mdoms dang dung can ma dang / bshad ba gtong ba dang 'gro ba dang len pa dang smra brjod dang gci ba 'dzag pa dang khu ba 'pho ba rnams kyis te /
translated: The many words are the path of explanation, feet, hands, speech, genitals, and the avadhūtī, and the emission of explanation, going, taking, speaking, the emission of feces, and the emission of semen.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams par dag pa so sor rigs drug po 'di rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams par dag pa so sor rigs drug po 'di rnams kyis so //
translated: These six families are the purities of Vairocana and so on.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams dang nang dang mngon par dbang bskur ba dang sgrub thabs dang ye shes zhes bya ba'i le'u lnga pa snod kyi 'jig rten dang sems can gyi 'jig rten dang sems can sbyong bar byed pa dang 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sgrub par byed pa
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams dang nang dang mngon par dbang bskur ba dang sgrub thabs dang ye shes zhes bya ba'i le'u lnga pa snod kyi 'jig rten dang sems can gyi 'jig rten dang sems can sbyong bar byed pa dang 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sgrub par byed pa
translated: The five chapters called World, Inner, Consecration, Means of Achievement, and Wisdom explain the world of the vessel, the world of sentient beings, the purification of sentient beings, the achievement of mundane powers,

original: dang mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i don rab tu gsal bar byed pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: dang mchog tu mi 'gyur pa'i don rab tu gsal bar byed pa rnams kyis so //
translated: and the illumination of the meaning of the unchanging.

original: bden gnyis ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dag gis so //
analyzed: bden gnyis ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dag gis so //
translated: The two truths are mundane and transcendent.

original: dang po'i sgra ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i don to //
analyzed: dang po'i sgra ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i don to //
translated: The first sound has the meaning of beginningless and endless.

original: chos rnams thams cad phyin ci ma log par //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad phyin ci ma log par //
translated: All phenomena are unerringly

original: sangs rgyas zin to zhes pas sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zin to zhes pas sangs rgyas so //
translated: awakened, and thus they are buddhas.

original: dang po yang 'di yin la sangs rgyas kyang ngo zhes pa ste skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral ba thams cad mkhyen pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dang po yang 'di yin la sangs rgyas kyang ngo zhes pa ste skye ba dang 'jig pa dang bral ba thams cad mkhyen pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This is the first and also the buddha, meaning the omniscient one free from arising and ceasing.

original: mtshan yang dag par brjod par //
analyzed: mtshan yang dag par brjod par //
translated: In the Litany of the Names of Mañjuśrī,🔽it says:

original: sangs rgyas thog ma tha ma med //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thog ma tha ma med //
translated: The Buddha is without beginning or end.

original: dang po'i sangs rgyas gnyis rtogs med //
analyzed: dang po'i sangs rgyas gnyis rtogs med //
translated: The primordial Buddha is without dualistic thought.

original: ces so // snying rje stong nyid sku can te //
analyzed: ces so // snying rje stong nyid sku can te //
translated: Compassion is the body of emptiness,

original: dus ni kun rdzob gzugs can ma //
analyzed: dus ni kun rdzob gzugs can ma //
translated: Time is the form of the relative.

original: stong nyid 'khor lo zhes par bshad //
analyzed: stong nyid 'khor lo zhes par bshad //
translated: Emptiness is explained as the wheel of time.

original: dus 'khor gnyis med mi 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dus 'khor gnyis med mi 'gyur pa'o //
translated: The wheel of time is nondual and unchanging.

original: yang na yi ge re re'i ming gis te /🔽ka yig las ni rgyu zhi ba //
analyzed: yang na yi ge re re'i ming gis te / ka yig las ni rgyu zhi ba //
translated: Or, it is by the name of each syllable:🔽From the syllable ka, the cause is pacified.

original: la yig las 'dir thim pa nyid //
analyzed: la yig las 'dir thim pa nyid //
translated: From the syllable la, here there is just dissolution.

original: rtsa yig las ni g-yo ba'i sems //
analyzed: rtsa yig las ni g-yo ba'i sems //
translated: From the syllable ra, the moving mind.

original: kra yig las rims bcings pas so //
analyzed: kra yig las rims bcings pas so //
translated: From the syllable kra, it is bound by the plague.

original: dang por zhes pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis ni gsal lo //
analyzed: dang por zhes pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis ni gsal lo //
translated: The first two verses are clear.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi byang gi sgor sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i lus dag pa'i don du chu dang cod pa na dag go //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi byang gi sgor sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i lus dag pa'i don du chu dang cod pa na dag go //
translated: At the northern gate of the mandala, for the sake of purifying the body with obscurations, there are the water and the crown empowerments.

original: lho'i sgor dag dag pa'i don du dar dpyangs kyi dbang ste /
analyzed: lho'i sgor dag dag pa'i don du dar dpyangs kyi dbang ste /
translated: At the southern gate, for the sake of purification, there is the empowerment of the silk ribbons.

original: rdo rje dang dril bu'i dbang bskur yang ngo //
analyzed: rdo rje dang dril bu'i dbang bskur yang ngo //
translated: The empowerment of the vajra and bell is also conferred.

original: shar du sems dag pa'i don du brtul zhugs chen po dang ming gi dbang bskur dag go //🔽nub tu ye shes dag @4a * //
analyzed: shar du sems dag pa'i don du brtul zhugs chen po dang ming gi dbang bskur dag go // nub tu ye shes dag @4a * //
translated: In the east, for the sake of the purity of mind, the great observances and the empowerment of name.

original: pa'i don du rjes su gnang ba'i dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: pa'i don du rjes su gnang ba'i dbang bskur ro //
translated: In the west, for the sake of the purity of gnosis, the empowerment of permission.

original: dag pa gzhan yang yod cing de gsungs pa /
analyzed: dag pa gzhan yang yod cing de gsungs pa /
translated: There are other purities, and they are stated:

original: sa la sogs pa'i khams drug rnams spyan ma la sogs pa rig ma drug nyid du grub pa gsal bar byed pa ni chu'i dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i khams drug rnams spyan ma la sogs pa rig ma drug nyid du grub pa gsal bar byed pa ni chu'i dbang bskur ro //
translated: The empowerment of water clarifies the establishment of the six awarenesses, such as Locanā, as the six elements, such as earth.

original: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga rnams rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa nyid du rdzogs pa ni cod pan gyi dbang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga rnams rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa nyid du rdzogs pa ni cod pan gyi dbang ngo //
translated: Similarly, the empowerment of the crown is the perfection of the five aggregates, such as form, as Vairocana, and so on.

original: du ba la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa bcu so sor thob pa'i don du dpa' bo'i dar dbyangs kyi dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa bcu so sor thob pa'i don du dpa' bo'i dar dbyangs kyi dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: The empowerment of the hero’s silk ribbon is for the sake of attaining each of the ten perfections, such as the perfection of patience.

original: rdo rje mi 'gyur che /
analyzed: rdo rje mi 'gyur che /
translated: The vajra is the great unchanging,

original: dril bu sangs rgyas skad ces par sbyar te /
analyzed: dril bu sangs rgyas skad ces par sbyar te /
translated: and the bell is the voice of the buddhas.

original: 'khor ba ba'i sdug bsngal mtha' dag gis mi phyed pa nyid kyis dang / de rnams 'byed par byed pa nyid kyis na bde ba mi 'gyur pa chen po kho na rdo rje'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba ba'i sdug bsngal mtha' dag gis mi phyed pa nyid kyis dang / de rnams 'byed par byed pa nyid kyis na bde ba mi 'gyur pa chen po kho na rdo rje'o //
translated: It is a great vajra, because it is not split by any of the sufferings of cyclic existence, and because it splits them.

original: mtha' yas pa'i lha dang mi la sogs pa rnams la de dang de'i skad kyis rgyun mi 'chad par chos kyi bdud rtsi bstan pa'i don du gzhom du med pa'i sgra'i rang bzhin rdo rje dril bu'o //
analyzed: mtha' yas pa'i lha dang mi la sogs pa rnams la de dang de'i skad kyis rgyun mi 'chad par chos kyi bdud rtsi bstan pa'i don du gzhom du med pa'i sgra'i rang bzhin rdo rje dril bu'o //
translated: The bell is the nature of the indestructible sound, in order to teach the nectar of the Dharma to the infinite gods, humans, and so forth, with their respective languages.

original: nyi ma zla ba zhes pa srog dang thur sel g-yas pa dang g-yon par 'bab pa dag gcig pa nyid aa wa dh'u t'i ru zhugs pa ste de'i don du rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bu dang ldan pa'i lag pa dag gis 'khyud pa'i tshul ni rdo
analyzed: nyi ma zla ba zhes pa srog dang thur sel g-yas pa dang g-yon par 'bab pa dag gcig pa nyid aa wa dh'u t'i ru zhugs pa ste de'i don du rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bu dang ldan pa'i lag pa dag gis 'khyud pa'i tshul ni rdo
translated: The sun and moon are the life and downward winds, which flow in the right and left channels, respectively. They are united in the avadhūtī, and for that purpose, the embrace with the vajra and bell in the hands is the vajra embrace.

original: rje dang rdo rje dril bu'i dbang bskur te bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: rje dang rdo rje dril bu'i dbang bskur te bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth empowerment is the vajra and bell empowerment.

original: tha mal pa'i yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa rnams 'gog pa las lha'i mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyis lha'i rnam par shes pa rnams stong pa nyid kyi gzugs kyi yul la bems po ma yin par rab tu 'jug par nges pas phyag
analyzed: tha mal pa'i yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa rnams 'gog pa las lha'i mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyis lha'i rnam par shes pa rnams stong pa nyid kyi gzugs kyi yul la bems po ma yin par rab tu 'jug par nges pas phyag
translated: The ordinary objects, sense faculties, and consciousnesses are stopped, and the sense faculties such as the divine eye definitely engage in the object of empty form with the divine consciousnesses without being inanimate.🔽

original: rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par byed pa nyid kyi phyir rdo rje brtul zhugs kyi dbang bskur te lnga pa'o //
analyzed: rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par byed pa nyid kyi phyir rdo rje brtul zhugs kyi dbang bskur te lnga pa'o //
translated: The initiation of the vajra-vow is the fifth, because it causes the attainment of the great seal, by the certainty of the engagement of the divine consciousnesses with the object of empty form, by means of the divine eye and so forth, without materiality, from the cessation of the ordinary objects, faculties, and consciousnesses.

original: bram ze la sogs pa'i rigs rnams gcig tu bsre ba'i dgongs pas che ge mo rdo rje zhes bya ba'i ming gi byed pa las byams pa la sogs pa tshangs pa'i gnas rnams yongs su rdzogs pas ming gi dbang bskur ba ste drug pa'o //🔽sems can gyi khams dpag tu med pa la bsam pa'i dbang ji lta bar kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rnam par dbye bas /
analyzed: bram ze la sogs pa'i rigs rnams gcig tu bsre ba'i dgongs pas che ge mo rdo rje zhes bya ba'i ming gi byed pa las byams pa la sogs pa tshangs pa'i gnas rnams yongs su rdzogs pas ming gi dbang bskur ba ste drug pa'o //🔽sems can gyi khams dpag tu med pa la bsam pa'i dbang ji lta bar kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rnam par dbye bas /
translated: The initiation of the name is the sixth, because it is the intention to mix into one the brahmin and so forth castes, by the rite of the name, “So-and-so Vajra,” and by the completion of the divine abodes such as love and so forth.🔽The initiation of the bell is the seventh, because it is the initiation of the bell, which is the cause of the attainment of the word-vajra, by the rite of the name, “So-and-so Vajra,” and by the completion of the divine abodes such as compassion and so forth.

original: mchog tu gsang ba'i rdo rje theg pa ston pa'i don du rjes su gnang ba'i dbang bskur bas sangs rgyas nyid rdzogs par byed pa ste bdun pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu gsang ba'i rdo rje theg pa ston pa'i don du rjes su gnang ba'i dbang bskur bas sangs rgyas nyid rdzogs par byed pa ste bdun pa'o //
translated: The seventh is the empowerment that perfects buddhahood through the empowerment that is permitted for the purpose of teaching the Vajra Vehicle, which is supremely secret.

original: dbang bskur bdun po 'di rnams ni @4b rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor rnam par spangs nas gzhan ras bris la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor du sbyin par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang bskur bdun po 'di rnams ni @4b rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor rnam par spangs nas gzhan ras bris la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor du sbyin par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: These seven empowerments are not to be given in maṇḍalas other than the maṇḍala of colored powder, such as the cloth maṇḍala, and so on.

original: sngar mdor bstan pa'i dbang bskur bcu gcig po rnams kyi nang nas 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub kyi khang bzangs  kyi them skas su gyur pa 'og ma'i kun rdzob kyi ngo bo can dbang bdun po rnams rnam par bshad nas rnal
analyzed: sngar mdor bstan pa'i dbang bskur bcu gcig po rnams kyi nang nas 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub kyi khang bzangs  kyi them skas su gyur pa 'og ma'i kun rdzob kyi ngo bo can dbang bdun po rnams rnam par bshad nas rnal
translated: Having explained the seven empowerments that are the staircase to the mansion of mundane and transcendent siddhis from among the eleven previously explained empowerments, the seven that are of the nature of relative [empowerments],

original: 'byor gyi kun rdzob tu gyur pa 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sgrub par byed pa don dam pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i dbang bskur gsum rnams /
analyzed: 'byor gyi kun rdzob tu gyur pa 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub sgrub par byed pa don dam pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i dbang bskur gsum rnams /
translated: now, the three empowerments that accord with the ultimate are the empowerments that accomplish mundane siddhis, which are of the nature of the relative of yoga.

original: bum pa zhes pa la sogs pas mdor bstan nas /
analyzed: bum pa zhes pa la sogs pas mdor bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the vase and so forth in brief,

original: mchog gi dngos grub kyi rgyu thun mong ma yin pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: mchog gi dngos grub kyi rgyu thun mong ma yin pa gsungs pa /
translated: he explains the uncommon cause of the supreme attainment.

original: slar yang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: slar yang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Again” and so forth.

original: shes rab chen po zhes pa kun du rtog pas ma brtags pa 'chad par 'gyur pa'i phyag rgya chen mo'o //
analyzed: shes rab chen po zhes pa kun du rtog pas ma brtags pa 'chad par 'gyur pa'i phyag rgya chen mo'o //
translated: “Great wisdom” is the great seal explained below, not imagined by conceptualization.

original: de bsgom pa las ye shes ni de las skyes pa mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba chen po ste /
analyzed: de bsgom pa las ye shes ni de las skyes pa mi 'gyur pa'i bde ba chen po ste /
translated: “From meditating on that” is from meditating on that, “wisdom” is the great bliss born from that, which is unchanging.

original: dbang bskur bcu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur bcu gcig pa'o //
translated: This is the eleventh initiation.

original: bum pa la sogs pa bzhi po 'di rnams kyi ming rjes su 'gro ba dang bcas pa rnams ni grangs ji lta bar 'gyur pa dang / mi 'gyur pa dang 'dzag pa dang mi 'dzag pa zhes bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa bzhi po 'di rnams kyi ming rjes su 'gro ba dang bcas pa rnams ni grangs ji lta bar 'gyur pa dang / mi 'gyur pa dang 'dzag pa dang mi 'dzag pa zhes bya ba rnams so //
translated: These four, the vase and so forth, are called “changing,” “unchanging,” “dripping,” and “not dripping,” respectively.

original: lus zhes pa la sogs pa go sla'o //
analyzed: lus zhes pa la sogs pa go sla'o //
translated: “Body” and so forth are easy to understand.

original: de bzhin du byis pa dang dar ma dang rgan po dang skye dgu'i bdag po'i ming can rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du byis pa dang dar ma dang rgan po dang skye dgu'i bdag po'i ming can rnams so //
translated: Likewise, “child,” “youth,” “old man,” and “lord of beings.”

original: shes rab ces pa lo bcu gnyis ma nas brtsams nas lo nyi shu ma'i bar te /
analyzed: shes rab ces pa lo bcu gnyis ma nas brtsams nas lo nyi shu ma'i bar te /
translated: Wisdom is from the age of twelve up to twenty.🔽The one who is fit to be empowered, who is pleasing to one’s mind, is touched on the branch of the breast. The bodhicitta moves.

original: rang gi sems dga' bar 'os pa dbang bskur ba'i skal ba can de'i nu ma'i yan lag la reg pas byang chub sems 'pho zhes pa gtsug tor gyi padma 'dab ma bzhi pa las khu ba bdud rtsi'i rgyun dpral ba'i padma 'dab ma bcu drug pa'i lte bar
analyzed: rang gi sems dga' bar 'os pa dbang bskur ba'i skal ba can de'i nu ma'i yan lag la reg pas byang chub sems 'pho zhes pa gtsug tor gyi padma 'dab ma bzhi pa las khu ba bdud rtsi'i rgyun dpral ba'i padma 'dab ma bcu drug pa'i lte bar
translated: From the four-petaled lotus of the uṣṇīṣa, the stream of the elixir of bodhicitta arrives at the center of the sixteen-petaled lotus of the forehead.

original: 'ongs pa na gang sku'i dga' ba dang / gsung gi dga' ba dang / thugs kyi dga' ba dang / ye shes kyi dga' ba'i bdag nyid kyi bde ba nyams su myong ba de ni dbang bskur dang po thob pa nyid kyi phyir rnal 'byor ba'o ma 'dzin pas dbang bskur ba byis pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'ongs pa na gang sku'i dga' ba dang / gsung gi dga' ba dang / thugs kyi dga' ba dang / ye shes kyi dga' ba'i bdag nyid kyi bde ba nyams su myong ba de ni dbang bskur dang po thob pa nyid kyi phyir rnal 'byor ba'o ma 'dzin pas dbang bskur ba byis pa zhes brjod do //
translated: When it arrives, the experience of the bliss that is the nature of the joy of the body, the joy of speech, the joy of the mind, and the joy of gnosis is the empowerment of the child, since it is the first empowerment obtained.

original: de nas de'i gsang bar rdo rje cung zad bskyod pas byang chub sems ni 'pho zhes pa mgrin pa'i padma 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis pa nas snying ga'i padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i lte bar gang sku'i mchog dga' dang / ngag gi mchog dga' @5a * //
analyzed: de nas de'i gsang bar rdo rje cung zad bskyod pas byang chub sems ni 'pho zhes pa mgrin pa'i padma 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis pa nas snying ga'i padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i lte bar gang sku'i mchog dga' dang / ngag gi mchog dga' @5a * //
translated: Then, by slightly shaking the vajra in the secret place, the bodhicitta is transferred, meaning that from the thirty-two-petaled lotus of the throat, it arrives at the center of the eight-petaled lotus of the heart.

original: dang ; thugs kyi mchog dga' dang / ye shes kyi mchog dga'i bdag nyid kyi bde ba nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de snga ma las shin tu lhag pa nyid kyi phyir dar ma gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: dang ; thugs kyi mchog dga' dang / ye shes kyi mchog dga'i bdag nyid kyi bde ba nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de snga ma las shin tu lhag pa nyid kyi phyir dar ma gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: The supreme joy of the body, the supreme joy of speech, the supreme joy of mind, and the supreme joy of gnosis are experienced. Since that is even more excellent than before, it is the secret empowerment.

original: de nas drag par bskyod pas g-yo bar bgrod ces pa lte bar padma 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi pa las gsang ba'i padma 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis par 'ongs pas khu ba zla ba'i cha bco lnga'i rtse mor son pas shin tu dang bar zhu ba
analyzed: de nas drag par bskyod pas g-yo bar bgrod ces pa lte bar padma 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi pa las gsang ba'i padma 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis par 'ongs pas khu ba zla ba'i cha bco lnga'i rtse mor son pas shin tu dang bar zhu ba
translated: Then, by shaking it strongly, it is said to arrive at the moving place. From the sixty-four-petaled lotus of the navel, it arrives at the thirty-two-petaled lotus of the secret place. Since the semen arrives at the tip of the fifteenth part of the moon, it melts into clarity.

original: g-yo ba zhes bya ba'i rdo rje nor bu'i bu ga'i mthar bgrod pas gang chen po sku'i khyad par gyi dga' ba dang / gsung gi khyad par gyi dga' ba dang / sems kyi khyad par gyi dga' ba dang / ye shes kyi khyad par gyi dga' ba'i bdag nyid kyi bde ba nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de ni rgan po ste shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba zhes bya ba'i rdo rje nor bu'i bu ga'i mthar bgrod pas gang chen po sku'i khyad par gyi dga' ba dang / gsung gi khyad par gyi dga' ba dang / sems kyi khyad par gyi dga' ba dang / ye shes kyi khyad par gyi dga' ba'i bdag nyid kyi bde ba nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de ni rgan po ste shes rab ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: The “movement” is the movement to the end of the opening of the vajra jewel. The experience of the bliss that is the nature of the special joy of the body, the special joy of speech, the special joy of mind, and the special joy of exalted wisdom is the “old man,” the initiation of the wisdom consort.

original: phyag rgya chen po zhes pa nam mkha' las byung ba'i gzugs te /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po zhes pa nam mkha' las byung ba'i gzugs te /
translated: The “great seal” is the form that arises from space.

original: de rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba'i sgom pa zhes bya ba la rjes chags las skyes pa g-yo med ces pa rdo rje nor bu las phyi rol du g-yo zhing zag pa 'gog pa /
analyzed: de rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba'i sgom pa zhes bya ba la rjes chags las skyes pa g-yo med ces pa rdo rje nor bu las phyi rol du g-yo zhing zag pa 'gog pa /
translated: The “meditation that arises from one’s own nature” is the “immobile” arising from passion, which is the cessation of the movement and emission outside of the vajra jewel.

original: gang gi zla ba bdud rtsi mi 'dzag pa'i bde ba nyid kyis na sku'i lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / ngag gi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / thugs kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i bdag nyid can ye shes chen po zhes bya ba dbang bskur bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi zla ba bdud rtsi mi 'dzag pa'i bde ba nyid kyis na sku'i lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / ngag gi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / thugs kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i bdag nyid can ye shes chen po zhes bya ba dbang bskur bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth initiation is called the great pristine awareness, which is the nature of the simultaneously born joy of the body, the simultaneously born joy of speech, and the simultaneously born joy of mind.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes sgrib pa med pa lhag par rtogs pa /
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes sgrib pa med pa lhag par rtogs pa /
translated: This is the supramundane pristine awareness, which is the realization of the absence of obscurations.

original: grub pa'i dngul chus zangs la sogs pa rnams gser gyi ngo bo bzhin du sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i phung po la sogs pa rnams de bzhin gshegs pa nyid la sogs pa skye dgu'i dngos por 'grub par byed pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: grub pa'i dngul chus zangs la sogs pa rnams gser gyi ngo bo bzhin du sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i phung po la sogs pa rnams de bzhin gshegs pa nyid la sogs pa skye dgu'i dngos por 'grub par byed pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Just as copper and so forth are transformed into the nature of gold by the elixir of alchemical transformation, so the aggregates and so forth, which are accompanied by obscurations, are transformed into the state of a tathāgata and so forth.

original: skye dgu'i bdag po'o //
analyzed: skye dgu'i bdag po'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the lord of all beings.

original: khu ba steng du gsang ba dang lte ba dang snying ga dang mgrin pa'i 'khor lo rnams su bgrod pa gnyis su med pa mi 'gyur pa 'di kho na'i ming rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: khu ba steng du gsang ba dang lte ba dang snying ga dang mgrin pa'i 'khor lo rnams su bgrod pa gnyis su med pa mi 'gyur pa 'di kho na'i ming rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa bzhi'o //
translated: The four names of Vajrasattva and so on are just this nondual, unchanging, upward-moving seminal essence that moves through the secret, navel, heart, and throat cakras.

original: dpral bar bgrod pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa la sogs pa rdo rje'i rnal 'byor rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: dpral bar bgrod pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa la sogs pa rdo rje'i rnal 'byor rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The four vajra yogas of complete purity and so on are the upward-moving seminal essence that moves through the forehead.

original: gtsug tor du bgrod pa ni dus kyi 'khor lo'i zhes pa sems dpa' drug rnams so //

analyzed: sa la sogs pa dkyil 'khor kho na chu tshod de //
translated: The mandala of earth, etc., is the hour.

original: de las chu tshod gcig ni 'jug pa dang 'byung ba dag gcig tu byas nas dbugs drug cu dang bcas pa'i brgya phrag gsum 'bab po //
analyzed: de las chu tshod gcig ni 'jug pa dang 'byung ba dag gcig tu byas nas dbugs drug cu dang bcas pa'i brgya phrag gsum 'bab po //
translated: From that, an hour is the flow of three hundred breaths together with sixty breaths.

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor lngas dus sbyor zhes bya bas dbugs brgya phrag bco brgyad rnams so //
analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor lngas dus sbyor zhes bya bas dbugs brgya phrag bco brgyad rnams so //
translated: Thus, by the five mandalas, the so-called muhurta, there are one thousand eight hundred breaths.

original: de ltar dus sbyor bcu gnyis kyis brgya phrag drug lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig dbugs dbyung ba dang 'jug pa rnams te /
analyzed: de ltar dus sbyor bcu gnyis kyis brgya phrag drug lhag pa'i stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig dbugs dbyung ba dang 'jug pa rnams te /
translated: Thus, by the twelve muhurtas, there are twenty-one thousand six hundred breaths, which are the exhalations and inhalations.

original: lus la chu tshod drug cu rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus la chu tshod drug cu rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: In the body, they are the sixty hours.

original: sna bug g-yon pa la 'bab pa'i rim pa ni 'dab ma'i dbus su ni sna bug gi dbus su'o //
analyzed: sna bug g-yon pa la 'bab pa'i rim pa ni 'dab ma'i dbus su ni sna bug gi dbus su'o //
translated: The flow in the left nostril is in the middle of the petals, in the middle of the nostril.

original: phung po rten ni 'byung ba zhes pa'i gsung la brten pa rnam par shes pa la sogs pa phung po rnams dang lhan cig rten nam mkha' la rlung dang chu dang me dang sa'i khams kyi dbye bas gsungs pa /
analyzed: phung po rten ni 'byung ba zhes pa'i gsung la brten pa rnam par shes pa la sogs pa phung po rnams dang lhan cig rten nam mkha' la rlung dang chu dang me dang sa'i khams kyi dbye bas gsungs pa /
translated: The statement “the aggregates are the support, the elements are the source” means that the aggregates, consciousness and so on, are supported together with the elements, which are divided into the wind, water, fire and earth elements in space.

original: nam mkha' sogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' sogs zhes bya'o //
translated: “Space and so on” means space and so forth.

original: gzhan las @10b so zhes pa snga ma bzhin du rtsa ba nas brtsams nas zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan las @10b so zhes pa snga ma bzhin du rtsa ba nas brtsams nas zhes pa'i don to //
translated: “From another” means from the root, as before.

original: g-yon par rnam shes sogs pas 'byung ba zhes spro bar rnam par gzhag par bya ste zla ba yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yon par rnam shes sogs pas 'byung ba zhes spro bar rnam par gzhag par bya ste zla ba yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: “On the left, emanation is established by consciousness and so on, the source,” because it is the moon.

original: g-yas par sa la sogs pas sdud pa ste nyi ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yas par sa la sogs pas sdud pa ste nyi ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: “On the right, gathering by earth and so on,” because it is the sun.

original: yang na gang g-yon par zla ba gnas pa shes rab dang bcas pa'i mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo dang / g-yas par thabs dang bcas pa'i spyan ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin sa la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: yang na gang g-yon par zla ba gnas pa shes rab dang bcas pa'i mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo dang / g-yas par thabs dang bcas pa'i spyan ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin sa la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo ste /
translated: Or else, on the left, the wheel of the consciousness mandala, etc., which is the nature of Akshobhya, etc., together with wisdom, which is the moon, and on the right, the wheel of the earth mandala, etc., which is the nature of Lochana, etc., together with means, which is the sun.

original: sngags dang lha'i bdag nyid spro ba dang sdud pa'i ngo bo can lhan cig skyes pa sems can thams cad la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sngags dang lha'i bdag nyid spro ba dang sdud pa'i ngo bo can lhan cig skyes pa sems can thams cad la gnas pa'o //
translated: The innate nature, which is the identity of mantra and deity, the essence of emanation and gathering, abides in all sentient beings.

original: shes rab ces pa la sogs pas mdor bstan pa de'i shes rab dang thabs nyid rgyas par 'chad de nub ces pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ces pa la sogs pas mdor bstan pa de'i shes rab dang thabs nyid rgyas par 'chad de nub ces pa'o //
translated: The nature of wisdom and means is explained extensively, beginning with wisdom and so on.

original: snam bu so sor nub tu ste nub phyogs su sa'i rang bzhin spyan ma dang rnam par snang mdzad dag go //
analyzed: snam bu so sor nub tu ste nub phyogs su sa'i rang bzhin spyan ma dang rnam par snang mdzad dag go //
translated: The cloth is the individual cloth, which is the west, the nature of earth, Lochana, and Vairochana.

original: shar du rlung gi rang bzhin sgron ma dang don yod grub pa dag go //
analyzed: shar du rlung gi rang bzhin sgron ma dang don yod grub pa dag go //
translated: In the east, the nature of wind, Prajna, and Amoghasiddhi.

original: de la rnam par snang mdzad kyi shes rab sgron ma ste don yod grub pa'i ni spyan ma'o zhes pa phan tshun zhal phyogs pas 'khyud pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par snang mdzad kyi shes rab sgron ma ste don yod grub pa'i ni spyan ma'o zhes pa phan tshun zhal phyogs pas 'khyud pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: The wisdom lamp of Vairocana, and the eye of Amoghasiddhi, are mutually facing, embracing.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpas mdzad pa'i thabs dang bral ba bsdus pa'i rgyud nyan pa ma rnyed pa rnams la yang dag par yid ches par byed pa'i don gsal bar shes par byed pa gsungs pa mthe bo zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpas mdzad pa'i thabs dang bral ba bsdus pa'i rgyud nyan pa ma rnyed pa rnams la yang dag par yid ches par byed pa'i don gsal bar shes par byed pa gsungs pa mthe bo zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, for those who have not found the complete tantra, which is devoid of the method of the Bodhisattva's performance, the statement the thumb etc. is for the sake of generating true confidence, and is for the sake of clearly understanding the meaning.

original: gang gi phyir lag pa g-yon pa'i mthe chung la sogs pa sor mo lnga rnams nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams kyi dbus su mthe bo dang ming med sa dang rlung gi rang bzhin dag gis 'khyud pa tshim par byed pa'i phyag rgya ste gsang ba'i
analyzed: gang gi phyir lag pa g-yon pa'i mthe chung la sogs pa sor mo lnga rnams nam mkha' la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams kyi dbus su mthe bo dang ming med sa dang rlung gi rang bzhin dag gis 'khyud pa tshim par byed pa'i phyag rgya ste gsang ba'i
translated: The five fingers of the left hand, beginning with the little finger, which have the nature of space etc., are in the middle embraced by the thumb and ring finger, which have the nature of earth and wind, the hand gesture which satisfies is secret.

original: dbang bskur gyi don du slob ma'i kha dang lha mnyes par byed pa la yang ston pa de'i phyir sa dang rlung shes rab dang thabs nyid du grub po //
analyzed: dbang bskur gyi don du slob ma'i kha dang lha mnyes par byed pa la yang ston pa de'i phyir sa dang rlung shes rab dang thabs nyid du grub po //
translated: In order to confer empowerment, the mouth of the disciple and the deity are joined. Therefore, earth and wind are established as wisdom and method.

original: 'dis bshad ba dang gci ba'i rtsa dag shes rab dang thabs nyid du gzhung btsugs so //
analyzed: 'dis bshad ba dang gci ba'i rtsa dag shes rab dang thabs nyid du gzhung btsugs so //
translated: This establishes the channels of feces and urine as wisdom and method.

original: g-yas su me'i rang bzhin gos dkar mo dang rin chen 'byung ldan dag go //
analyzed: g-yas su me'i rang bzhin gos dkar mo dang rin chen 'byung ldan dag go //
translated: On the right, Gaurī and Ratnasaṃbhava have the nature of fire.

original: gzhon nu chu'i rang bzhin m'a ma k'i dang 'od dpag tu med pa dag go //
analyzed: gzhon nu chu'i rang bzhin m'a ma k'i dang 'od dpag tu med pa dag go //
translated: On the left, Māmakī and Amitābha have the nature of water.

original: de la 'od dpag med kyi shes rab gos dkar mo ste rin chen 'byung ldan gyi m'a ma @11a * //
analyzed: de la 'od dpag med kyi shes rab gos dkar mo ste rin chen 'byung ldan gyi m'a ma @11a * //
translated: There, the wisdom of Amitābha is Gaurī, and the wisdom of Ratnasaṃbhava is Māmakī.

original: k'i'o ; / gang gi phyir lag pa g-yas pa'i gung mo dang mdzub mo me dang chu'i rang bzhin dag gis 'khyud pa ral gri'i phyag rgya la ston pa de'i phyir me dang chu dag shes rab thabs nyid du grub ste /
analyzed: k'i'o ; / gang gi phyir lag pa g-yas pa'i gung mo dang mdzub mo me dang chu'i rang bzhin dag gis 'khyud pa ral gri'i phyag rgya la ston pa de'i phyir me dang chu dag shes rab thabs nyid du grub ste /
translated: Since the middle and index fingers of the right hand, which have the nature of fire and water, respectively, embrace the sword mudra, fire and water are established as wisdom and method.

original: 'dis ni ro ma dang rkyang ma dag shes rab dang thabs nyid do //
analyzed: 'dis ni ro ma dang rkyang ma dag shes rab dang thabs nyid do //
translated: This shows that the lalanā and rasanā are wisdom and means.

original: dbu ma la steng gi phyogs su rnam par gnas pa stong pa'i ngo bo mi bskyod pa ni 'og gi phyogs su rnam par gnas pa mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig 'khyud pa'o //
analyzed: dbu ma la steng gi phyogs su rnam par gnas pa stong pa'i ngo bo mi bskyod pa ni 'og gi phyogs su rnam par gnas pa mi 'gyur pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang lhan cig 'khyud pa'o //
translated: The central channel, located above, is the essence of emptiness, Akṣhobhya, and the lower part, located below, is the essence of unchanging wisdom, the perfection of wisdom, who embraces him.

original: phan tshun zhes pas 'chad par 'gyur pa'i steng dang 'og tu gnas pa rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma dang rdo rje sems dpa' dag 'khyud pa yang ltos pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun zhes pas 'chad par 'gyur pa'i steng dang 'og tu gnas pa rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma dang rdo rje sems dpa' dag 'khyud pa yang ltos pa'o //
translated: The word “each other” indicates that Vajradhātvīśvarī and Vajrasattva, located above and below, respectively, also embrace each other.

original: snga ma phyed shes par byed pa ni /
analyzed: snga ma phyed shes par byed pa ni /
translated: The first half of the verse is explained as follows.

original: gang gi phyir lag pa g-yas pa'i khu tshur la mthe chung zla ba phyed pa'i rnam par byas pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lag pa g-yas pa'i khu tshur la mthe chung zla ba phyed pa'i rnam par byas pa /
translated: The left hand is made into a fist, with the little finger in the shape of a half-moon.

original: mi bskyod pa'i mche ba'i phyag rgya gang yin pa de kho na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gri gug gi phyag rgya yin pa de'i phyir stong pa dang ye shes kyi rigs can dag shes rab dad thabs nyid do //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i mche ba'i phyag rgya gang yin pa de kho na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gri gug gi phyag rgya yin pa de'i phyir stong pa dang ye shes kyi rigs can dag shes rab dad thabs nyid do //
translated: The mudra of Akshobhya's fangs is the mudra of the wisdom-sword of the perfection of wisdom. Therefore, those of the families of emptiness and gnosis are wisdom and means.

original: 'dis ni kun 'dar ma dang dung can ma dag shes rab dang thabs nyid do //
analyzed: 'dis ni kun 'dar ma dang dung can ma dag shes rab dang thabs nyid do //
translated: This shows that the lalana and rasana are wisdom and means.

original: de ma thag tu 'chad par 'gyur pa'i tshigs su bcad pas rigs drug pa 'khyud pa'i shes par byed pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ma thag tu 'chad par 'gyur pa'i tshigs su bcad pas rigs drug pa 'khyud pa'i shes par byed pa gsungs te /
translated: The next verse explains the knowledge of the six families' embrace.

original: gang gi phyir lag pa'i mthil g-yon pa dang g-yas pa sbyar bar byas pa spyi bor bzung ba na gang gi tshe stong pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin sor mo rnams phan tshun sbyor ba dkyil 'khor bcu po yang dag sbyor ba byas pa de'i tshe rdo rje
analyzed: gang gi phyir lag pa'i mthil g-yon pa dang g-yas pa sbyar bar byas pa spyi bor bzung ba na gang gi tshe stong pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin sor mo rnams phan tshun sbyor ba dkyil 'khor bcu po yang dag sbyor ba byas pa de'i tshe rdo rje
translated: When the fingers of the nature of emptiness, etc., are mutually joined, the ten circles are perfectly joined. At that time, the vajra

original: sems dpa'i rdo rje rtse gcig pa'i phyag rgya yin zhing /
analyzed: sems dpa'i rdo rje rtse gcig pa'i phyag rgya yin zhing /
translated: is the mudra of the single-pointed vajra of the sattva.

original: de kho na rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma'i gri gug gi phyag rgya chu gri'i rnam pa can yin te /
analyzed: de kho na rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma'i gri gug gi phyag rgya chu gri'i rnam pa can yin te /
translated: That is the mudra of the knife of Vajradhatviśvarī, which is like a water knife.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag shes rab dang thabs nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag shes rab dang thabs nyid do //
translated: Therefore, they are wisdom and method.

original: phyi rol du gri gug dang bcas pa'i rdo rje rtse gcig pa'i bdag nyid rigs drug pa gang yin pa de yang nang du mnyam pa ste nyi ma dang zla ba mnyam par 'bab pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol du gri gug dang bcas pa'i rdo rje rtse gcig pa'i bdag nyid rigs drug pa gang yin pa de yang nang du mnyam pa ste nyi ma dang zla ba mnyam par 'bab pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: That which is externally the nature of a single-pointed vajra with a knife, which is the sixth class, is internally equal, because the sun and moon are equally flowing.

original: dbu ma'i rtsa ste aa wa dh'u t'ir 'bab na'o ;
analyzed: dbu ma'i rtsa ste aa wa dh'u t'ir 'bab na'o ;
translated: It flows in the central channel, the avadhūtī.

original: / mnyam pa ni skye ba'i dus su 'bab pa las spro ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: / mnyam pa ni skye ba'i dus su 'bab pa las spro ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: Equality is the cause of emanation from the flow at the time of birth.

original: 'chi ba'i dus su 'bab pa las sdud pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus su 'bab pa las sdud pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: It is the cause of withdrawal from the flow at the time of death.

original: yang na rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi de kho na nyid sgom pas phyi rol du 'bab pa 'gags pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phung po la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyi phyir spro ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: yang na rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi de kho na nyid sgom pas phyi rol du 'bab pa 'gags pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phung po la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyi phyir spro ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: Or else, the cause of emanation is because the cessation of the external flow through the yogi’s meditation on reality is the cause of the supramundane aggregates and so on.

original: @11b 'khor ba pa rnams kyi ma 'gags pa ni phung po la sogs pa rnam par 'jig par byed pa nyid kyis ni sdud pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: @11b 'khor ba pa rnams kyi ma 'gags pa ni phung po la sogs pa rnam par 'jig par byed pa nyid kyis ni sdud pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The non-cessation of those in cyclic existence is the cause of the collection, by virtue of destroying the aggregates, etc.

original: de la mnyam pa ni sngar brjod pa'i sna bug g-yon par 'bab pa'i phung po lnga dang / sna bug g-yas par 'bab pa'i khams lnga dang / lte ba dang gsang ba dang nor bu'i padmar gnas pa sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje rnams dbu ma'i rtsar son pa na gcig nyid yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la mnyam pa ni sngar brjod pa'i sna bug g-yon par 'bab pa'i phung po lnga dang / sna bug g-yas par 'bab pa'i khams lnga dang / lte ba dang gsang ba dang nor bu'i padmar gnas pa sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje rnams dbu ma'i rtsar son pa na gcig nyid yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: There, the equality is that the five aggregates flowing into the left nostril and the five elements flowing into the right nostril, and the vajra body, speech, and mind located at the navel, secret, and jewel lotuses, are one, not different, when they reach the central channel.

original: de ltar rlung 'bab pa'i rnam par gzhag pa'i zol gyis dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i lha dang ye shes kyi rnam par gzhag pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rlung 'bab pa'i rnam par gzhag pa'i zol gyis dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i lha dang ye shes kyi rnam par gzhag pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: Thus, the arrangement of the deities of the mandala circle and the arrangement of the pristine awarenesses are taught by the pretense of the arrangement of the winds' flow.

original: gang gi tshe steng du zla ba dang nyi ma dang sgra gcan gyi rtsa rnams 'gog pa de'i tshe 'og tu bshang gci dang khu ba'i rtsa rnams 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe steng du zla ba dang nyi ma dang sgra gcan gyi rtsa rnams 'gog pa de'i tshe 'og tu bshang gci dang khu ba'i rtsa rnams 'gog pa'o //
translated: When the channels of the moon, sun, and Rāhu above are blocked, then the channels of feces, urine, and semen below are blocked.

original: de bzhin du steng du gsum po grol na 'og tu 'ang grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du steng du gsum po grol na 'og tu 'ang grol ba'o //
translated: In the same way, if the three are liberated above, they are also liberated below.

original: rtsa drug po de rnams kyang snga ma bzhin du spro ba dang sdud pa'i byed pa can no //
analyzed: rtsa drug po de rnams kyang snga ma bzhin du spro ba dang sdud pa'i byed pa can no //
translated: And those six nāḍīs, as before, have the function of emitting and reabsorbing.

original: lug la sogs pa mi mnyam pa'i dus sbyor la skyes pa tshe thung ba rnams kyi lus la rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan mi mnyam ste /
analyzed: lug la sogs pa mi mnyam pa'i dus sbyor la skyes pa tshe thung ba rnams kyi lus la rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan mi mnyam ste /
translated: In the bodies of those born in the unequal zodiacs of Aries and so on, who have short lives, wind, bile, and phlegm are unequal.

original: mi mnyam pa las srog ces bya ba'i rlung dbyu gu lnga lnga 'bab pa'i rim pa las brgal nas g-yon pa'i rtsar lhag par 'bab po //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa las srog ces bya ba'i rlung dbyu gu lnga lnga 'bab pa'i rim pa las brgal nas g-yon pa'i rtsar lhag par 'bab po //
translated: From the inequality, the prāṇa wind, which normally flows in the right nāḍī in five- and-a-half periods, exceeds its flow in the left nāḍī.

original: ci ltar lhag ce na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci ltar lhag ce na gsungs pa /
translated: How does it exceed?

original: mtshan mo gcig ste nyin mtshan 'bab pa de'i tshe 'chi ltas kyi nyin zhag nas brtsams te lo gsum rnams kyis 'chi bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo gcig ste nyin mtshan 'bab pa de'i tshe 'chi ltas kyi nyin zhag nas brtsams te lo gsum rnams kyis 'chi bar shes par bya'o //
translated: When it flows for one night and one day, then after three years, beginning from the day of death omens, one should know that death will occur.

original: de bzhin du glang la sogs pa mnyam pa'i dus sbyor la skyes pa rnams kyi rtsa g-yas pa la nyin mtshan lnga 'bab pa las lo gsum rnams kyis 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du glang la sogs pa mnyam pa'i dus sbyor la skyes pa rnams kyi rtsa g-yas pa la nyin mtshan lnga 'bab pa las lo gsum rnams kyis 'chi ba'o //
translated: Likewise, for those born in the conjunction of equality of the bull and so on, the nāḍī on the right is five days and nights.

original: de ltar mdor bstan nas re zhig nyi ma'i 'chi ltas rgyas par 'chad de /
analyzed: de ltar mdor bstan nas re zhig nyi ma'i 'chi ltas rgyas par 'chad de /
translated: Having explained that in brief, now the lunar death sign is explained in detail.

original: khyim gyi bdag nyid kyi 'dab ma bcu gnyis pa lte ba'i padma'i nang gi yongs su bskor ba'i shar gyi 'dab ma nyin mtshan lngar srog 'bab po //
analyzed: khyim gyi bdag nyid kyi 'dab ma bcu gnyis pa lte ba'i padma'i nang gi yongs su bskor ba'i shar gyi 'dab ma nyin mtshan lngar srog 'bab po //
translated: In the center of the navel lotus, which is a twelve-petaled lotus of the nature of the houses, the prāṇa moves in the eastern petal for five days and nights.

original: de nas g-yas su bskor bas 'dab ma gnyis pa la phyogs zhes pa bcu'o //
analyzed: de nas g-yas su bskor bas 'dab ma gnyis pa la phyogs zhes pa bcu'o //
translated: Then, moving clockwise, in the second petal, there are ten directions.

original: gsum pa tshes rnams te bco lnga rnams so //
analyzed: gsum pa tshes rnams te bco lnga rnams so //
translated: In the third, there are fifteen lunar days.

original: bzhi pa la nyi shu'o //🔽lnga pa la de gnyis rnams te /
analyzed: bzhi pa la nyi shu'o // lnga pa la de gnyis rnams te /
translated: In the fourth, there are twenty.

original: nyi shu rtsa lnga rnams so //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa lnga rnams so //
translated: In the fifth, there are twenty-five.

original: drug pa la de nyid rnams las gcig lhag rim pas te nyi shu rtsa drug go //
analyzed: drug pa la de nyid rnams las gcig lhag rim pas te nyi shu rtsa drug go //
translated: In the sixth, there are twenty-six, one more than that.

original: bdun pa la slar yang gcig lhag rim pas te nyi shu rtsa bdun no //
analyzed: bdun pa la slar yang gcig lhag rim pas te nyi shu rtsa bdun no //
translated: In the seventh, there are twenty-seven, one more than that.

original: nyin @12a * //
analyzed: nyin @12a * //
translated: 33 days.

original: zhag sum cu gsum rgyu na zhes pa brgyad pa la bco lnga'o //
analyzed: zhag sum cu gsum rgyu na zhes pa brgyad pa la bco lnga'o //
translated: In the eighth, 15 days.

original: dgu pa la bcu'o //
analyzed: dgu pa la bcu'o //
